summary.para: The CERT_REVOCATION_STATUS structure contains information on the revocation status of the certificate. It is passed to and returned by . On return from the function, it specifies the status of a revoked or unchecked context.
Size of this structure in bytes.

Upon input to CERT_REVOCATION_STATUS, cbSize must be set to a size greater than or equal to the size of a CERT_REVOCATION_STATUS structure. Otherwise, CERT_REVOCATION_STATUS returns FALSE and returns E_INVALIDARG.

Specifies an index value for the rgpvContext array passed to . It is the index of the first context in that array that was revoked or that could not be checked for revocation. For information about the contexts that were not checked, CertVerifyRevocation is called again, specifying a rgpvContext array that contains the unchecked contexts from the original list.

Specifies the returned error status. This value matches the return value of on return from the call to . For the list of these error values, see the table in the Return Values section of CertVerifyRevocation.
Specifies the cause of the error. This member is set only if dwError is CRYPT_E_REVOKED. It contains a code that indicates why the context was revoked. It can be one of the following values.

description.para: No reason was specified for revocation.
It is known or suspected that the subject's private key or other aspects of the subject validated in the certificate are compromised.
It is known or suspected that the CA's private key or other aspects of the CA validated in the certificate are compromised.
The subject's name or other information in the certificate has been modified but there is no cause to suspect that the private key has been compromised.
The certificate has been superseded, but there is no cause to suspect that the private key has been compromised.
The certificate is no longer needed for the purpose for which it was issued, but there is no cause to suspect that the private key has been compromised.
The certificate has been placed on hold.

summary.para: Depending on cbSize, this structure can contain this member. If this member is TRUE, the revocation freshness time returned by dwFreshnessTime is valid.
Depending on cbSize, this structure can contain this member. If present, this member gives the time in seconds between the current time and when the CRL was published.
